page.title: 01GEOGRAPHICAL LAYOUT
page.content: This is a rural area in the parishes of Llangeler and Penboyr. The dividing line between the two is the River Bargod which flows through blocks 3538 and 3539. (Bargod is a Welsh word meaning edge,eaves) The land surface is uneven and varied but beautiful, overlooking the fertile Teifi Valley. On the southern side there is the peaty high ground _ now cultivated and used as grazing land for sheep and cattle. The land slopes gradually to the north,forming deep and densely wooded valleys, and finally levelling out to form the rich pasture land on the banks of the Teifi.Farming is very prominent in the district and is the main industry since the decline of the woollen industry in the 1920s.Most of the farms are mixed and dairy farms. {A.Davies.
